subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... So, they don t use the same format, but will give you equivalent information. For example, the test runner in IntelliJ gives me Done: 11 of 11    Failed:
messageBody:
> > Of course, to get this you need:
> > 1) A test runner that will report in this format. :)
> Most don't, but they will
> > give equivalent information.
>
> So...?

So, they don't use the same format, but will give you
equivalent information. For example, the test runner in
IntelliJ gives me "Done: 11 of 11 Failed: 2", which is
wrong because there's one failure and one error. OTH, on the
side bar, there's a red icon and an orange icon
respectively. The default JUnit GUI runner shows up as
"Runs: 11 Errors: 1 Failures: 1", but gives me a red
bar. The Ant test runner (heavily based on the default JUnit
console runner) gives me "Tests run: 11, Failures: 1,
Errors: 1". Transforming the resulting log file through the
JUnitReport task, and I get:

Tests | Failures | Errors
11 | 1 | 1

With nice column layouts for failures and errors seperately.

Of course, the test runners in IntelliJ and And aren't part
of JUnit.

Robert.
